The Drama Department is in search of a parent volunteer (to receive Lincoln volunteer hours) to be an assistant choreographer for our fall musical, Aladdin JR. Our choreographer will be working with us until the end of September, at which time she will go on maternity leave. We will need the assistant choreographer to finish out the show and lead all choreography rehearsals in her absence!

Responsibilities:
- Attend all choreography rehearsals
- Assist our choreographer in whatever capacity she needs
- Hold cleaning rehearsals with the cast starting in October
- Wear a mask at all rehearsals

Qualifications:
- Have a dance background (preferably experienced in musical theater)
- Work well with 6th-9th graders

Rehearsals will be held from 4:00-6:00PM, Monday through Thursday starting on August 27th.
Performances will occur in November, with tentative dates of November 19-21.

If interested, please contact Sarah Chaffin at drama@lincoln-academy.org.

Patriot Day- Best Dress

It has been a tradition at Lincoln Academy for us to wear best dress on September 11th.

Most boys come in a shirt and tie, and girls come in a skirt or dress.

Over the years, our focus has changed from those who died on September 11th, to those who have given their lives to preserve our freedom throughout history.

We encourage families to talk together about the freedoms we all enjoy and those who helped make it possible.
During school this day, we will observe a moment of silence.

Your student may choose to dress up or wear a school uniform on this day. This is NOT a free dress day.

Thank you,
Lincoln Academy Administration

Make-A-Wish All Star Basketball Game

The All Star Basketball game has found a new date and place!
It will be held Monday, April 17th at 6:30 p.m. in the Sky Ridge High School Main Gym. We are excited to announce tickets are once again for sale!

You may purchase a ticket to the game in the front office.
A family pass is just $20.
Individual tickets are $5.
Cash and checks accepted.

If you previously purchased a ticket, with the old date on them, you DO NOT need to exchange them the new date. Your original ticket will be honored the night of April 17th.

This is going to be a fun night! Come cheer on our Lincoln teachers as they take on an All Star team made up of past BYU players.

There will also be drinks and chips will be available for purchase at the game, contests, and a drawing for a chance to win nice prizes.

All proceeds from the game will be given directly to Make-A-Wish Utah. Come support our school and help us make wishes come true for children right here in Utah County! See you at the game!

Back to School night is TONIGHT! Hope to see you there. Please stop by the Parent Council Table. We will be fundraising for technology. Every year the parent council asks for a $35 dollar donation per family. Those funds are being used to provide technology for our students. Last year we were able to purchase 35 Chromebooks and a charging cart. This classroom set costs about $8000. Our long term goal is to purchase two more Chromebook filled carts for our classrooms.

Unlike other schools that raise funds by asking the students to sell stuff and have multiple fund raising events throughout the year, Lincoln Parent Council asks you for this one time donation. Thank you so much for your help in reaching our goals!

Our Fall Health Week is coming up soon! In order to inspire our students to keep healthy habits that week (and beyond!), we are in need of some cool prize donations. If you have a connection or just want to donate something, please contact Rachel Pierce:rachelwhitepierce@gmail.com.

Ideas include but are definitely not limited to: coupons or gift certificates to healthier restaurants (Roxberry, Subway, Chick-fil-A), or activity centers (Lowe's, Momentum, Classic Fun Center). Other ideas might include: new, unused sports or camping equipment, electronics related to health like Fit Bit (wouldn't that be a cool prize?!), water bottles, or healthy non-perishable food (Gatorade, Clif Bars, sunflower seeds, trail mix).
If you can donate any of these kinds of items, it would be SO appreciated!

Health Week is November 9-13!
